content.text:
# IEEE David Sarnoff Award

The IEEE David Sarnoff Award was a Technical Field Award presented in 1959â€“2016 by the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE). It was awarded annually for exceptional contributions to electronics.
The award was established in 1959 by the RCA Corporation; in 1989 the Sarnoff Corporation became its sponsor. It consisted of a bronze medal, certificate and honorarium, and was presented each year to an individual or small team (up to three people).
The award was discontinued in 2016.
Recipients
Source: [https://web.archive.org/web/20180922140110/https://www.ieee.org/about/awards/bios/sarnoff-recipients.html IEEE]
* 1997: Milton Feng
* 1998: Tatsuo Izawa
* 1999: Gerard A. Mourou
* 2000: Alastair Malcolm Glass
* 2001: P. Daniel Dapkus
* 2002: Young-Kai Chen
* 2003: Peter Asbeck
* 2004: Frederick A. Kish, Jr.
* 2005: Pierre Tournois
* 2006: Mau-Chung F. Chang
* 2007: Umesh K. Mishra
* 2008: James Coleman
* 2009: Kerry J. Vahala
* 2009: Kam-Yin Lau
* 2009: Yasuhiko Arakawa
* 2010: Mark Rodwell
* 2011: Constance J. Chang-Hasnain
* 2012: Hideo Ohno
* 2013: Sajeev John
* 2014: Larry A. Coldren
* 2015: Pallab Bhattacharya
* 2016: Hiroyuki Matsunami
